ATTENDANCE IS MANDATORY. crummer@cis.ufl.edu	omm@cis.ufl.edu       	gjc@cis.ufl.edu Office hrs: 10-11AM: M,W,F  	M,W,F 4th; M 5th	M,W,F 6th; Tu 7th TEXT : Data Abstraction and Problem Solving with C++, (Walls And Mirrors), by Frank Carrano, 1995 Practice exercises will be assigned but not collected. UNDERGRADUATE CONSULTANT: Michael Mark, is a consultant on duty for this course. He holds consulting hours in the "fishbowl" area on the 2nd floor of CSE near the CIRCA labs (just to the left as you enter the lab) with this current schedule. Here are the current hours: In that discussion section, you will 1) take occasional quizzes (announced or not), 2) receive instruction on C++ implementation details of the abstractions you are learning, and 3) get instructions and guidance on the assigned personal and homework projects which you will submit on-line. You will using Borlands Turbo C++ on any CIRCA machines on campus. If you submit a homework early and then improve upon it, you may resubmit. Homework may be submitted late if there has not been a solution given out or discussed in class. The penalty is 15% for each 24 hours or fraction thereof. ==== 750 COP 3530                Spring 1996      Dr. Crummer      PAGE 2 of 2 ANTICIPATED COURSE CONTENT AND SCHEDULE: Week    Text Number	Pages	Chapter  	Topics =====   ======  =======		====== 1	1-45	    1		Problem solving & Software Engineering A1-A26	    		Appendix, Summary of C++ fundamentals 3	71-95	    2		Mad scientist, Searching, Binary search 6       140-164	    4		Pointers, Pointer-based linked lists 7	164-184	    4		More on linked lists implementations and variations 8       203-222	    5		Using Recursion: Towers, Lists, Backtracking 12	353-372	    8		Class relationships, virtual functions, late binding, abstract base class 15      437-503     10 		Binary tree: as an ADT, implementations, traversals, and applications ============================================================================ In addition to the homework projects you submit electronically, here are your personal homework exercises from the textbook: Pages  Exercise Number -----  --------------- 94	1,2,4 95	2,4,7,9,13,19 137	1,2,3,5,7 193	1,2,3,5 196	3,7,8,9 198	28,33 241	14,15,16,17 296	2,4,6,7,9 298	1,2,6,8,11,14 388	2,3,4,7 390	2a,7 504 	1-10 505	2a,3,6,7,11a-c FINAL EXAM MONDAY APRIL 29, 1996  (3:00-5:00 PM, CSE 222 or TBA) EMail: crummer@cis.ufl.edu
